tendsto_abs_tan_of_cos_eq_zero:
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `nhds_within.ne -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `nhds_within.ne -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `exprℂ -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `nhds_within.ne -/
theorem tendsto_abs_tan_of_cos_eq_zero {x : exprℂ} (hx : cos x = 0) :
    Tendsto (fun x => abs (tan x)) (nhds_within.ne x) atTop :=
  by
  simp only [tan_eq_sin_div_cos, ← norm_eq_abs, norm_div]
  have A : sin x ≠ 0 := fun h => by simpa [*, sq] using sin_sq_add_cos_sq x
  have B : tendsto cos (nhds_within.ne x) (nhds_within.ne 0) :=
    hx ▸ (has_deriv_at_cos x).tendsto_punctured_nhds (neg_ne_zero.2 A)
  exact
    continuous_sin.continuous_within_at.norm.mul_at_top (norm_pos_iff.2 A)
      (tendsto_norm_nhds_within_zero.comp B).inv_tendsto_zero
#align tendsto_abs_tan_of_cos_eq_zero tendsto_abs_tan_of_cos_eq_zero
tendsto_abs_tan_at_top:
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `nhds_within.ne -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `real.pi -/
theorem tendsto_abs_tan_at_top (k : ℤ) :
    Tendsto (fun x => abs (tan x)) (nhds_within.ne ((2 * k + 1) * real.pi / 2)) atTop :=
  tendsto_abs_tan_of_cos_eq_zero <| cos_eq_zero_iff.2 ⟨k, rfl⟩
#align tendsto_abs_tan_at_top tendsto_abs_tan_at_top
has_strict_deriv_at_tan:
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `exprℂ -/
/-
Copyright (c) 2018 Chris Hughes. All rights reserved.
Released under Apache 2.0 license as described in the file LICENSE.
Authors: Chris Hughes, Abhimanyu Pallavi Sudhir, Jean Lo, Calle Sönne, Benjamin Davidson
-/
theorem has_strict_deriv_at_tan {x : exprℂ} (h : cos x ≠ 0) : has_strict_deriv_at tan (1 / cos x ^ 2) x :=
  by
  convert(has_strict_deriv_at_sin x).div (has_strict_deriv_at_cos x) h
  rw [← sin_sq_add_cos_sq x]
  ring
#align has_strict_deriv_at_tan has_strict_deriv_at_tan
has_deriv_at_tan:
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `exprℂ -/
theorem has_deriv_at_tan {x : exprℂ} (h : cos x ≠ 0) : has_deriv_at tan (1 / cos x ^ 2) x :=
  (has_strict_deriv_at_tan h).has_deriv_at
#align has_deriv_at_tan has_deriv_at_tan
differentiable_at_tan:
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `exprℂ -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `exprℂ -/
@[simp]
theorem differentiable_at_tan {x : exprℂ} : differentiable_at (exprℂ) tan x ↔ cos x ≠ 0 :=
  ⟨fun h => continuous_at_tan.1 h.continuous_at, fun h => (has_deriv_at_tan h).differentiable_at⟩
#align differentiable_at_tan differentiable_at_tan
deriv_tan:
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `exprℂ -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `exprℂ -/
@[simp]
theorem deriv_tan (x : exprℂ) : deriv tan x = 1 / cos x ^ 2 :=
  if h : cos x = 0 then
    by
    have : ¬differentiable_at (exprℂ) tan x := mt differentiable_at_tan.1 (Classical.not_not.2 h)
    simp [deriv_zero_of_not_differentiable_at this, h, sq]
  else (has_deriv_at_tan h).deriv
#align deriv_tan deriv_tan
continuous_at_tan:
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `exprℂ -/
@[simp]
theorem continuous_at_tan {x : exprℂ} : ContinuousAt tan x ↔ cos x ≠ 0 :=
  by
  refine' ⟨fun hc h₀ => _, fun h => (has_deriv_at_tan h).continuous_at⟩
  exact not_tendsto_nhds_of_tendsto_atTop (tendsto_abs_tan_of_cos_eq_zero h₀) _ (hc.norm.tendsto.mono_left inf_le_left)
#align continuous_at_tan continuous_at_tan
cont_diff_at_tan:
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `exprℂ -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `«exprℕ∞» -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `exprℂ -/
@[simp]
theorem cont_diff_at_tan {x : exprℂ} {n : «exprℕ∞»} : cont_diff_at (exprℂ) n tan x ↔ cos x ≠ 0 :=
  ⟨fun h => continuous_at_tan.1 h.continuous_at, cont_diff_sin.cont_diff_at.div cont_diff_cos.cont_diff_at⟩
#align cont_diff_at_tan cont_diff_at_tan
